N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 116.5 - Educational plan

State Regulations

Each home or facility subject to the provisions of this

Part shall prepare a long-range educational plan to meet the needs of the
children residing therein. Such plan shall be updated on an annual basis and
maintained by the chief administrator of the home or facility in a form
approved by the commissioner and shall include, but need not be limited to, the
following: (a) a narrative description
of the content and scope of the educational programs and services available to
pupils in the home or facility, including, but not limited to: (1)
curriculum areas provided and the
certification areas of the instructor; (2)
support programs available; and
(3)
administrative staff involved with the
educational program and their credentials; (b) a description of the student population
during the current school year and the two school years immediately preceding. Such description shall include: (1)
the
number of students according to age, academic functioning levels in reading and
math, length of stay, and dominant language, including the number of bilingual
or limited English proficient youths in the facility. Such information shall be
maintained on a form prescribed by the commissioner; and
(2)
the school districts of legal
residence; (c) a
description of anticipated future educational programming needs and the basis
for that projection; and
(d) the
estimated budget to support such plan. Notes
